alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 11 at 7:50AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Meigs. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 749 AM EDT, The Shade River at Chester had crested around 18.5 feet, which is 1.5 feet above the flood stage. At this stage the Sugar Run Creek Bridge is flooded 200 feet downstream from the Oak Hill Road, and Shade River Bridge. In addition, low lying areas adjacent to the river are flooded. - The Shade will recede back within its banks later this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chester. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
